result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Lasusa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Case 15CF945
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. DNA surcharge and sample are waived on this case. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
**COUNTS 1 & 2 WILL REMAIN OPEN UNTIL SENTENCING AT A LATER DATE.- COUNTS 1 & 2 WERE DISMISSED AND READ IN 08/24/16.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant is to be released tomorrow, August 25, 2016 by 9:00 a.m. directly to WCS.

Defendant Matthew L Lasusa in court with attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counts #1 and #2 are dismissed and read into Count #1 of 15CF945.  The Defendant was previously sentenced on Count #3.

The Court does grant the request at this time but requests that Attorney Moncada contact Attorney Will for further information regarding status of DTC program and then the Court will schedule a hearing promptly.

COUNT 3 ONLY
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Matthew L Lasusa in court with attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court will proceed to plea and sentencing on count #3 only.  The remaining counts will be scheduled for a plea hearing in August as the Defendant is on the wait list for Drug Treatment Court.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 3,  Court finds defendant guilty.   The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #3:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT. (consecutive to 15CF945)
1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.
3 YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

*D/L REVOCATION: 3 YEARS.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 3 YEARS.

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR;

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*Peform 50 Hours Community Service. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $ 35.00 (apply cash bail posted by Ellen Rudolph in case 15CF945- to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department);

FINE:  $1519.00 (apply cash bail posted by Ellen Rudolph in case 15CF945 and refund balance to posters);

CONDITION TIME:  6 MONTHS NON WORKING HOURS w/Standard Release Conditions consecutive to 15CF945. 

DNA SAMPLE/SURCHARGE: WAIVED BY THE COURT.
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
2ND AMENDED
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Matthew L Lasusa in court with attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties request an adjournment to continue with further negotations.  The Court grants the adjournment and scheduled the matter accordingly.  Plea and sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew L Lasusa in court with attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Moncada requests a brief adjournment.  The Court sets the matter for plea and sentencing in on 15CF945.  The Defendant is on the wait list for drug treatment court on 14CF910.  The Court instructs the Defendant he must comply with conditions of bail including WCS monitoring.  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Order requiring defendant to comply with any test WCS requests.
From Atty Wolff dated 3/9/16 (supposed to be 3/4/16?) requesting WCS provide alternate testing to defendant.  Proposed order attached.
Plea hearing at 04-15-2016 10:30 am

DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $5000.00, NEEDS TO POST AN ADDITIONAL $3000.00. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Matthew L Lasusa in court with attorney Peter Wolff for Arnold Arthur Moncada.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Robert Ebbe with Pro Health Care appeared by phone.  Attorney Wolff advises the Court  the Defendant went to test at Any Lab Test Now this morning but the results have not been returned.  Attorney Ebbe advises the Court that Pro Health care is not set up to provide testing as ordered by the Court.  Attorney Will requests the Defendant be ordered to submit to urine tests or pay for saliva test if approved by WCS.  Attorney Wolff requests that the Court not increase cash bail.  The Court increases cash bail by an additional $3000.00 with the same conditions.   Attorney Wolff will be contacting WCS regarding possible saliva testing.  Any motion filed the week of March 7, 2016 to be heard by Judge Ramirez.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 03-03-2016 11:00 am

The Court addresses the Defendant's non compliance with WCS.  The Defendant is to report to WCS for a urine test today and if unable to provide a sample at WCS the Defendant is to have a blood test taken at the Waukesha Memorial Hospital Emergency Department.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Hearing at 03-02-2016 01:30 pm

The Court addresses the Defendant non compliance with WCS.   Attorney Wolff advises the Court that the hospital will not follow the court order for testing.  The Court orders Attorney Wolff to contact the attorney for the hospital and have him appear at the next hearing.  Mr. Lasusa is to contact his physician regarding solutions for testing to comply with bond requirements. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew L Lasusa in court with attorney Peter Wolff for Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Wolff addresses the Court regarding the test results on 15CF945 and requests the Court not take any action on the bail and allow the Defendant to obtain the new test results.  The State has no objection but requests that the time period be modified from 48 hours to 24 hours at an acceptable alternative facility and have the results sent directly to the Court. .  The Court will prepare an  order regarding testing.  The February 24, 2016 hearing remains as scheduled.  Attorney Wolff to advise the Court at the next hearing the status of the Defendant's admittance into Drug Treatment Court.
Hearing at 02-08-2016 02:30 pm

The Court orders Attorney Wolff to file with the Court by Friday, February 5, 2016 a plan for testing and recent blood test results.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing at 02-04-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Matthew L Lasusa in court with attorney Arnold Arthur Moncada.  Pablo Galaviz & Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Moncada advises the Court the Defendant is on the waiting list for the Drug Treatment Court but the parties have reached an agreement.
